item.title: Roblox: A Dusty Trip Radio Song ID Codes (October 2024)
item.description:
Even though A Dusty Trip is representative of the survival genre, there is a relaxing element attached to it. This is not surprising because you and your friends must drive through the wasteland almost always. But you can diversify the monotonous ride. Therefore, this guide will tell you about all Radio Song ID codes in A Dusty Trip .

These Roblox codes allow you to use the radio in your vehicle and listen to different music along the way. However, not all players know how to use them. Listening to the radio is actually much easier than it seems.

Updated October 13, 2024, by Artur Novichenko: With this update, we found and added 3 new songs. Use them in your game to diversify the experience.

All Radio Song ID Codes in A Dusty Trip

As we said, A Dusty Trip Radio Song ID codes allow you to use the radio while surviving in the wasteland. Each of them offers a unique Song so every player can find something they like. For your convenience, we have compiled a list of all the Radio Song ID codes in A Dusty Trip and the songs they play.

ID Code Radio Song

15689453529 Phonk (NEW)
16190782181 Back It Up (NEW)

130794482 I Knew You Were Trouble Song
5410083912 Dreamstate Song
6781116057 Sick Flu Song
1842658587 Like It! Song

1847344655 Crazy Song
1840040640 Fleek Song
1845904911 Elisa Song
6828176320 Rolling Day Song
1837103530 Lucid Dreams Song
1843415134 Home Song
1837241189 Cumbia Song
7019388713 Petar Will Son

How to Use A Dusty Trip Radio Song ID Codes

You must unlock this feature before using your car's radio and Song ID Codes. Unfortunately, this can only be done by spending Robux.

  1. Launch A Dusty Trip .
  2. Then, find a radio advertising banner in the lobby and click on it.
  3. After that, spend 149 Robux to purchase a Car Radio Gamepass.
  4. Finally, when you build your vehicle, interact with the radio on the dashboard and enter one of the codes above to listen to your favorite music while driving.

item.title: Roblox: Shoot Wall Simulator Codes (October 2024)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Shoot Wall Simulator Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes in Shoot Wall Simulator
  • How to Play Shoot Wall Simulator
  • The Best Roblox Simulator Games Like Shoot Wall Simulator
  • About the Shoot Wall Simulator Developers

Shoot Wall Simulator is one of the most popular games on Roblox , not to mention one of the most intuitive. However, users still need to train a lot to progress in the game, which can sometimes mean a lot of grinding. Thankfully, it's possible for Roblox players to accelerate this process by redeeming the Shoot Wall Simulator codes found below.

Updated October 13, 2024, by Artur Novichenko: All codes in this guide are still valid. Be sure to use them while they’re active to get some extra rewards.

All Shoot Wall Simulator Codes

Working Shoot Wall Simulator Codes

  • Fruit - Enter this code to claim 500 Oranges.
  • Medic - Enter this code to claim Wins Potions.
  • Firefighter - Enter this code to claim Wins Potions.
  • Toilet - Enter this code toTNT claim Damage Potion.
  • GiftBox - Enter this code to claim 3 GiftBox.
  • Welcome - Enter this code to claim 100 Bullets.
  • TNT - Enter this code to claim 2 TNT.
  • Turret - Enter this code to claim Turret.
  • Season6 - Enter this code to claim Damage Potions.
  • Xmas - Enter this code to claim Damage Potions.
  • Pomni - Enter this code to claim 30 Gems.
  • Enchant - Enter this code to claim 30 Gems.
  • AURA - Enter this code to claim 30 Gems.
  • Halloween - Enter this code to claim 30 Gems.
  • Huge - Enter this code to claim Wins Potions.
  • Giant - Enter this code to claim Damage Potions.
  • seasonboost - Enter this code to claim 2x 30-minute Win Potions.
  • Crown - Enter this code to claim Damage Potions.
  • Camera - Enter this code to claim Damage Potions.
  • M0del86 - Enter this code to claim Damage Potions.
  • Season1 - Enter this code to claim 2x 30-minute Lucky Potions.
  • Music - Enter this code to claim a 30-minute Lucky Potion.
  • 95KLikes - Enter this code to claim 2x 5-minute Win Potions.
  • Medieval - Enter this code to claim 3x 5-minute Damage Potions.
  • 350KMembers - Enter this code to claim 2x 30-minute Win Potions.
  • Boss - Enter this code to claim 2x 30-minute Win Potions.
  • Fight - Enter this code to claim 30-minute Damage Potions.
  • 100KMembers - Enter this code to claim 3x 30-minute Lucky Potions.
  • 100KV - Enter this code to claim Free Skewnet Pet.
  • 10KFaves - Enter this code to claim 2x 30-minute Damage Potions.
  • 10KMember - Enter this code to claim 2x 30-minute Win Potions.
  • 1KLikes - Enter this code to claim 5x 5-minute Damage Potions.
  • 1MVisits - Enter this code to claim 5x 5-minute Damage Potions.
  • 2.5KMembers - Enter this code to claim 2x 30-minute Lucky Potions.
  • 2.5MVisits - Enter this code to claim 7x 5-minute Lucky Potions.
  • 250KV - Enter this code to claim 2x 5-minute Damage Potions.
  • 2KMembers - Enter this code to claim 2 x 5-minute Damage Potions.
  • 500KV - Enter this code to claim 3x 30-minute Win Potions.
  • Chef - Enter this code to claim 2x 30-minute Win Potions.
  • Pet - Enter this code to claim Free Common Pet.
  • Race - Enter this code to claim 2x 30-minute Lucky Potions.
  • Robot - Enter this code to claim 2x 30-minute Damage Potions.
  • Summer - Enter this code to claim 4x 5-minute Win Potions.
  • Trading - Enter this code to claim 2x 30-minute Damage Potions.

All Expired Shoot Wall Simulator Codes

  • Hunter - Enter this code to claim 30 Gems.

How to Redeem Codes in Shoot Wall Simulator

The process of redeeming codes in this game is very simple and quite similar to most other Roblox games with a code redemption system. If players still need help, they can refer to the step-by-step instructions below:

  • First, launch the Shoot Wall Simulator .
  • After that, find and tap or click on the Codes button located in the middle right.
  • When the button is pressed, a menu will appear with the Enter Code field in which it is necessary to enter any of the above codes.
  • To redeem the code, tap or click Submit.

But keep in mind that each code can be redeemed only once.

How to Play Shoot Wall Simulator

It is straightforward to play Shoot Wall Simulator . To make effective progress, players need to shoot and break walls and get Wins. These Wins act as a game currency and can be used to move to new locations. To get Wins faster, it is necessary to buy pets and train. To make this process much more accessible, players will find two buttons at the bottom of the screen: Auto Train and Auto Shoot. Players can press one of them and go into AFK.

The Best Roblox Simulator Games Like Shoot Wall Simulator

If players want to try a new but similar gaming experience but don't know which games to opt for, they will find all the help needed here. Below, they will find 5 games like Shoot Wall Simulator . All of them are of the highest quality and should be enjoyed by fans of this game.

  • Mining Simulator 2
  • Anime Fruit Simulator
  • Bee Swarm Simulator
  • Youtube Simulator Z
  • Clicker Mining Simulator

About the Shoot Wall Simulator Developers

This game was developed by Toptier Production, also known as Wsh Studios. In addition to the Shoot Wall Simulator , they have another quite interesting game called Kung Fu Simulator , which players are recommended to check out.

item.title: Beginner Tips For Sword Art Online Fractured Daydream
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Experiment with archetypes based on 6 character types with unique abilities and fighting styles.
  • Focus on story completion to unlock characters and improve player rank for co-op missions.
  • Utilize unique awakened states for special abilities and target enemy weaknesses for extra damage.

Sword Art Online Fractured Daydream is the latest RPG based on the hit anime Sword Art Online , and a return to the series for developer Dimps. Their previous game, Fatal Bullet , is a favorite among many SAO fans. Fractured Daydream offers a similar mix of single-player story and online co-op fun.

WIth 21 characters, all with their own fighting styles and equipment to worry about, there's a lot for new players to get to grips with. These tips will help both with starting the game, and getting players up to speed for the online co-op missions that make up the endgame.

7 Experiment With Archetypes

Finding A Play Style

  • Fighter: Melee all-rounders with access to perfect block and dodge moves.
  • Tank: Larger health pool, defensive abilities, and aggro pull.
  • Rogue: DPS focused melee characters with lower health and defense.
  • Ranger: Guns and ranged abilities, with timed shots and weak spot targeting.
  • Mage: Ranged magic DPS with AOE and elemental abilities.
  • Support: Multiplayer focused characters with buffs and healing abilities.

The 21 characters in Sword Art Online: Fractured Daydream all fit into one of the six archetypes above. Within that, each character has their own quirks and elemental affinities. Characters need to be leveled separately to get them to character rank 30, so it's worth experimenting to find a preferred play style.

6 Focus On The Story First

Unlocking Characters And Improving Player Rank

Before players have to worry about leveling efficiently and running through the multiplayer modes, it's worth finishing the single player story. This will help get players up to player rank 20, which is where they need to be to start taking on the co-op raid bosses.

Completing the story is also how players unlock the full roster of characters. Players can start taking on the early co-op missions after just a few story missions, though. For players who want a bit of variety, they can work through the Tier-1 co-op missions alongside the story.

5 Understand Unique Awakened States

The Purpose Of The Yellow Bar

For most characters, there's an additional meter above the health bar, which charges as they battle. Depending on the character, this has different effects, but players can think of it as a limit break or awakened state.

For example, with Kirito, activating the gauge when full causes him to regenerate health while attacking, and reduces his skill cooldowns. Keep an eye on this bar and make sure to use it, and learn what benefits it gives to each character.

4 Weak Points And Damage Types

Elemental Damage Matching Helps A Lot

Players will quickly notice that their weapon rank has a big effect on the damage they deal. What they might not realize, though, is that targeting an enemy's elemental weakness is worth around 10 weapon ranks of extra damage.

Equally important is targeting enemy weak spots, especially with tougher enemies and bosses. Ranged characters will have an easier time of this, but melee characters that can fly can also easily attack the right spots for extra damage.

3 Fastest Missions For EXP And Leveling

Efficient Progress

After finishing the story, players will immediately want to run through each Tier 1 co-op mission. This will unlock the first co-op raid boss, Skull Reaper. After Skull Reaper is unlocked, this is players' most efficient method of EXP gain, both for character and player rank.

After clearing the Tier 2 co-op missions and reaching player rank 35, the second raid boss, SBC Trommel, will unlock. This provides more player rank EXP than Skull Reaper, but running Skull Reaper can still give faster EXP yields due to its shorter completion time.

In the latter game, Tier 3 co-op missions can give higher player rank EXP yields after players reach rank 55. Tier 3 co-op mission 3 seems to be the highest overall EXP per hour yield, even after the final raid boss is unlocked at rank 85.

2 When To Upgrade Gear

Hold On To Your Materials

Gear leveling, upgrading, dismantling and crafting can be confusing in Fractured Daydream . Fortunately, it's a superfluous system for most of the game. As long as a player's gear rank is close to their player rank, they'll be fine. Once players approach the Tier 3 co-op content, then it's time to refine and specialize.

Avoid getting rid of materials and gear throughout the game, especially those with good passive stats. Players can use Effect Spheres to take passive effects from unwanted gear and apply it to other pieces. This is the key to build specialization in the late game.

1 Know The Co-op Modes

Awakened Levels, Explained

At first, the co-op elements of the game might be a little daunting for newcomers, but once players get used to it, it's the best way to earn rewards and EXP. The structure of co-op missions goes like this: players complete objectives and kill monsters in a group of four. As they do this, they gain awakened levels, unlocking new special attacks at specific milestones. That means players get stronger as the mission progresses. Then, once a few objectives have been completed, teams join up with 16 other players for a final round of monster and boss killing.

This is where "Switch" moves come in. These are powerful moves that co-op groups can execute on bosses. Watch for button prompts on-screen in these multiplayer boss battles to pull them off. Co-op boss raids work the same way, except the missions are condensed into a big final boss fight.

item.title: Destiny 2: How To Complete Activation Encounter In Vesper's Host Dungeon
item.description:
The first dungeon ever to be released on both contest and normal mode on the first day in Destiny 2 , Vesper's Host is a bit of an anomaly. The activity takes players to the orbit of Europa, into the remains of a broken, old Bray space station that might look awfully familiar to those who have played the Deep Stone Crypt raid. And when it comes to that raid in particular, there are many similarities between the two activities, starting off at the first encounter.

Images were acquired during contest mode, but the normal mode of the first encounter does not have the enrage timer.

1 Complete Activation

Bank Three Nuclear Cores In The Back Of The Arena

The goal of the encounter is to collect three nuclear cores and bank them in three deposits found at the back of the arena (behind the giant white orb on the floor). They can be found inside the rooms branching off from the main arena, their doorways marked by a yellow brain, a blue lung, and a red heart.

The encounter begins with a brig and enemies spawning in. Wipe them out, and one of them will drop the Scanner Protocol . One player should pick it up. The lights above the three doors around the arena will start to flash red. Enter any of them as a team, and kill enemies as you proceed to the end.

Each doorway will lead to a slightly different room, but the principle and the contents will always be the same: two large Fallen mini-bosses, which must be defeated. Players will also find the Operator Protocol. It should be picked up by another player, while the third without a role defends against waves of enemies. Note that these Protocols, unlike the Deep Stone Crypt ones, are timed . When they expire, the player holding them will die. If your timer is low, bank the protocol into one of the terminals and pick it back up to refresh the timer.

The player holding Scanner should look at their radar at the top left of the screen to find blinking, yellow symbols as they walk around the chamber . These symbols are actually the keypads around the rooms that the Operator player needs to shoot.

When Scanners approach each keypad, a sound will play, and the radar will be updated. If the yellow mark turns white, the Operator needs to shoot that specific keypad . Four keypads must be shot per room.

Doing this will drop a nuclear core. Pick it up , and bring it back to the starting room to bank it. Keep an eye on the radiation level while carrying a core, as at stack 10x of Radiation, players will die. The fireteam should keep passing the core to one another, and it can even be dropped to the ground for a few seconds without repercussions.

More enemies and another brig will have spawned into the room. Kill them to open up the nuclear core banking stations , which will initially be protected by a blue shield. Now the round begins again, and players must enter through another doorway, kill the enemies, pick up the Scanner and Operator Protocols, and shoot the right keypads to spawn a nuclear core. After the final core is acquired, a gigantic brig will spawn. The encounter is completed when all three cores are banked.

item.title: Red Dead Redemption PC Players Now Have the Perfect Halloween One-Two Punch
item.description:
Updates on the Red Dead Redemption franchise have been few and far between in recent months, but some recent developments have thankfully changed this in a big way. While some of this news can be enjoyed by fans of all RDR platforms, PC players are in for a particularly exciting time over the next few weeks.

Rockstar recently announced plans to bring some of the most iconic Red Dead Redemption content to PC platforms, compounding a recent trend of the studio making the beloved franchise more accessible across the gaming industry. While this by itself is a huge cause of celebration for long-time fans of the franchise, October is also set to see a fairly comprehensive Halloween-inspired update shake up the gameplay of Red Dead Online . Wider RDR accessibility and fresh Red Dead Online content have been two massive points of desire for the franchise's community, and October is perfectly set up for both of these wishes to be more than met.

Red Dead Redemption's PC Move is Complimented By Red Dead Online's Exciting Halloween Update

Red Dead Redemption was originally released in 2010, being considered as one of Rockstar's most famous and influential titles to this date. The game turned the Red Dead franchise into a fun arcade-style shooter into a deeply emotive and immersive powerhouse, becoming the only other Rockstar IP that can attempt to rival and compete with the massively popular Grand Theft Auto games.

Over the years, fans have wanted Red Dead Redemption to be more widely available across platforms and more modern hardware. Xbox users have long been able to access the game through backwards compatibility, with PS5 players now even being able to play the title at 60FPS thanks to an update in 2023. Before that, RDR surprisingly came to the Nintendo Switch, with PC players long having wondered when they would receive some positive news regarding the title.

These hopes have finally been answered, with Rockstar recently announcing that a PC version of Red Dead Redemption is set to launch on October 29. This version of the game will even come with PC-specific enhancements to bring the tile to a level of fidelity and performance never seen before, making the end of the 14-year wait for Red Dead Redemption on PC even sweeter. On top of this, the announcement also confirmed that RDR 's major expansion, Undead Nightmare , will also be coming to PC with these same enhancements.

Undead Nightmare and Red Dead Online Are the Perfect Combo For Halloween Fun

Undead Nightmare sees the world of Red Dead Redemption descend into a zombie apocalypse, with the expansion being considered as some of the best DLC in gaming history. The PC release of Undead Nightmare just before Halloween is perfect timing, and players also have Halloween-inspired content to look forward to in Red Dead Online around the same time. Throughout October, a variety of new sinister missions and cosmetics are arriving to Red Dead Online , complete with heightened rewards and challenges for players to tackle.

This October update for Red Dead Online also sees the return of past Halloween content like the All Hallow's Call to Arms limited-time survival mode, as well as the premium Halloween Pass. Players have waited long enough for a PC release of the original Red Dead Redemption , and this, combined with the ongoing Halloween content of Red Dead Online , makes this October one to remember for fans of Rockstar's Old West franchise.
